Senator John McCain , once a stalwart proponent of a more moderate immigration policy , turned himself an immigration hawk to parry a challenge in the Republican primaries .参议员约翰?麦凯恩，曾经是更加温和移民政策的坚定支持者，然而在共和党初选中他却变成了移民鹰派以避开质问。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: Scots variant of obsolete stalworth, from Old English stǣl 'place' + weorth 'worth'

entry.tran: (尤指某个政党的)忠实拥护者，坚定分子
entry.def: A stalwart is a loyal worker or supporter of an organization, especially a political party.

example.ex: His free-trade policies aroused suspicion among Tory stalwarts...
example.tran: 他的自由贸易政策在保守党的忠实拥护者中间引起了怀疑。

example.ex: Moving to Germany, he became a stalwart of the revered Kurt Edelhagen Orchestra.
example.tran: 搬到德国后，他成了著名的库尔特·埃德尔哈根管弦乐队的一名忠实听众。

entry.tran: 忠实的;坚定的;完全可靠的
entry.def: A stalwart supporter or worker is loyal, steady, and completely reliable.

example.ex: ...a stalwart supporter of the colonial government...
example.tran: 殖民政府的忠实拥护者

example.ex: The stalwart volunteers marched in this morning ready to go to work.
example.tran: 忠实的志愿者们今天上午已就位，随时准备开始工作。

example.ex: I knew I was never in any danger with my stalwart bodyguard around me.
example.tran: 我知道有强壮的保镖在我的周围，我永远不会有什么危险。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who is loyal to their allegiance (especially in times of revolt)
1. having rugged physical strength; inured to fatigue or hardships;

sentences.sentence: "a stouthearted fellow who had an active career in the army"
